alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Dutchess; Greene; Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 7:21PM EDT until September 07 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Ulster County in east central New York... Northwestern Dutchess County in east central New York... Northwestern Columbia County in east central New York... Greene County in east central New York... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 721 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Kerhonkson, or 7 miles northeast of Ellenville, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Kingston, New Paltz, Ellenville, Catskill, Saugerties, Rhinebeck, Hunter, Wallkill, Hyde Park, Milton, Plattekill, Hurley, Woodstock, Coxsackie, Highland, Red Hook, Windham, Athens, Prattsville and High Falls. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
